headline: Retirees Are Quietly Accumulating This 8% Dividend Grower With a Half-Century of Increases
summary: PepsiCo just paid its March 31, 2026 quarterly dividend of $1.4225 per share, marking another milestone in a streak that few companies can match. With 50+ consecutive years of dividend increases, PEP has earned Dividend King status—the gold standard for income investors seeking reliability in retirement portfolios. headline: PepsiCo Says Consumers Like Price Cuts on Snacks
summary: PepsiCo said it is seeing early signs that slashing prices of brands from Doritos to Lay’s will be positive for its sales.  Speaking at an investor conference, Chief Executive Ramon Laguarta said that early data on how consumers feel about the cuts—which are up to 15% on some products—is “very good.”  Growth in the business had slowed in recent years as people balked at purchases in response to rising prices.

headline: Walmart and Costco Are 1/3 of XLP’s Defensive Portfolio, Creating A Huge Risk For A Defensive Holding
summary: The consumer staples sector exists because people need to eat, clean, and maintain routines regardless of what the economy does. Consumer Staples Select Sector SPDR Fund (NYSEARCA:XLP) packages that defensive logic into a single ticker, concentrating 99.3% of its portfolio in companies that produce essentials like groceries, household goods, and beverages. With $16.2 billion in ... Walmart and Costco Are 1/3 of XLP’s Defensive Portfolio, Creating A Huge Risk For A Defensive Holding
